ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course provided some deadlines and structure to the potentially nebulous process of writing our theses. I didn't feel like many of the readings were particularly helpful only because I already had pretty clear idea of what I was writing about. However, the deadlines were very helpful in urging me to produce tens of pages of writing that will likely make it into my final thesis. Also, being in community with the other WGSS majors was an invaluable part of my senior fall. This would not have been possible without this seminar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think we could have gotten more thorough feedback from each other

Progress and Research reports are helpful in tangibly putting the thesis process in motion. The course is very flexible and molded to the needs of the students. I wish this was a year long course, with the second half being more of a writers workshop kinda thing.

I think the course was still finding itself. The readings and exact details of assignments were not always very helpful for my specific project, but the professor gave us space to modify assignments to serve our individual needs. I came out of the seminar with a thoughtful presentation on my thesis and tens of pages of research/ethnographic notes. I think it would have been nice for the final assignment to be more specifically a partial draft of our thesis or maybe like 10-20 pages of polished content. Maybe also we could have had one meeting with all of our advisors present to bounce ideas across one another (but this sounds like a nightmare to organize).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Its required for all majors sooooo.no choice but to take it

Yes, the opportunity to work on an extended project like this has been very valuable to me. WGSS is unique in that undergrads get so much support to produce a thesis. My project began in the junior spring semester and has been becoming more rich and exciting since then.
